entries.meaning: Speed that exceeds a reasonable or permitted rate.
examples: Trashes are clogs strapped round the neck of a dog to prevent his overspeed.

verbs.description: overspeed (third-person singular simple present overspeeds, present participle overspeeding, simple past and past participle (mostly US) oversped or (mostly UK) overspeeded)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To travel excessively fast or beyond the permitted rate.
examples: Caully-flowers over-speeding to pome and head..should be quite erradicated [sic – meaning eradicated].

entries.meaning: (usually transitive, sometimes intransitive, chiefly mechanics) To operate an engine or machine too fast.
examples: The device should be periodically tested by overspeeding the engine say once a month.

entries.meaning: (India, intransitive) To speed; to drive a vehicle faster than the permitted speed limit.
